events.name: IoTTechspresso: Developing Business Case + Architecting IoT Solutions
events.description:
The Internet-of-Things (IoT) is considered to be the next logical evolution of the Web and is expected to herald extensive new services in manufacturing, healthcare, finance, transportation, energy & education. However, building a smart, connected product is complex as it requires the integration of various technical elements such as sensors, electromechanical actuators, microprocessors, communications networks and data analytics platforms. In designing an IoT solution, one also needs to take into account a host of considerations such as interoperability between disparate systems, data security, user privacy, product scalability and total cost of ownership. In this Techspresso talk, Aditi Gupta will address these challenges by sharing her extensive knowledge in solution design garnered from working on a wide range of IoT projects. Aditi is a Solution Architect with hands-on experience in designing and implementing large scale and complex Internet-of-Things (IoT) and Machine-to-Machine (M2M) projects . She currently works at NCS as Lead Consultant.  


************************************************************ DATE & AGENDA: Thursday, 10th Nov 2016 • 06:00 pm – Registration & Networking  • 06:45 pm – Introduction  • 07:00 pm – Expert Talk by Aditi • 08:15 pm - QnA  • 08:30 pm - Networking continued ************************************************************  VENUE: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent #02-01, SG139951 ************************************************************  ************************************************************  Note: Please note that photography and videography will be carried out throughout the event.  IoT SG, Event Sponsors, Supporters may use some or all of these images in its print publications, digital, social platforms and/or marketing channels. We also ask some personal information and questions during registration. This data is used to do further due diligence to improve the quality of events. This data may also be shared with sponsoring organisations, speakers to help them to collaborate more efficiently. We do not sell your data.
events.location: NUS Enterprise@Blk71, 71 Ayer Rajah Crescent, #02-01, Singapore 139951

events.name: ArtScience Late: Singapore Eco Film Festival x iNCH
events.description:
ArtScience Late: Singapore Eco Film Festival x iNCH
Thursday 10 November 2016
7.15pm (NC16) Singapore Premier of Can You Dig This*
9.00pm Letters to Ubin by iNCH
Expression Gallery (Level 4)
Free admission. 

ArtScience Late goes green this November as we celebrate Singapore Eco Film Festival. Get together for the screening of Can You Dig This, a documentary that follows guerilla gardeners uprooting the status quo in one of the most notorious U.S neighbourhoods with an urban gardening revolution. After that, switch off and retreat with iNCH as she carries everyone on an elemental journey with Letters to Ubin.

Find out more about SIngapore Eco Film Festival at http://sgeff.com/

*Film is rated NC16. Kindly produce IDs at the door.

events.name: The Curious Case of Blockchain Technology
events.description:
The new digital era is knocking our doors, and these are arguably the most exciting times post invention of internet itself. Open your doors to the new advanced digital world, which promises to simplify and automate a lot of things around. In the list of remarkable technologies that promise to change the world, is Blockchain.  Conceived in 2008, this concept is generating a lot of buzz. So, lets catch-up and and know more about this technology, its use cases beyond crypto-curreinces, and impact. 



Program: 7:00 PM - 7:15 PM: Networking and Refreshments 7:15 PM - 8:00 PM: TechTalk session 8:00 PM - 8:15 PM: Q & A 8:15 PM onwards: Networking and Refreshments
events.location: Palo IT Innovation Studio, 56 Boat Quay, Singapore

events.name: Science Hack Day Idea Pitches and Team Building
events.description: Science Hack Day attendees are invited to join pre-event gathering to pitch their ideas and team up with others. We are happy to announce the presence of our guest speaker Preetam Rai - an Education Technologist who will talk about 'Science Hacks for Home Improvement' Submit your hack idea now or join an existing team https://pad.okfn.org/p/shdsg16  Agenda7:30 - 8:00: Welcome and networking8:00 - 8:20: Science Hacks for Home Improvement8:30 - 9:00: Idea Pitches9:00 - 9:30: Team building  Links:* Watch a Science Hack intro video https://youtu.be/Dzb_QCYxi3I * Check out Science Hack ideas from Belgaum event: https://public.etherpad-mozilla.org/p/shdindia* Check out more ideas from Berlin event: https://pad.okfn.org/p/SHDB16
